description: Theming doesn't work, many UI elements look a bit out of place and especially overshadowed. Nonetheless, it's a great project with tons of potential
I can see it is installed, yet which lapce returns nothing. So where is it and how does one start if from the command line?
summary: Where is it, and how does one start it?

description:
I'm pretty impressed with v0.2.1 
It isn't quite on par with other editors in terms of features yet, but it is very fast and nice to work with rust in.
very snappy and the new aleph theme looks amazing.
summary: very snappy and the new aleph theme looks amazing

description: I always prefer non bloated text-editors for programming, especially in Rust. It has all the plugins I need and very fast. Lapce will be now my daily driver for any software and web developments.

Pro:
Simple yet powerful. 
No bloat.
Working over SSH is a killer feature for managing a PI fleet. 
Language extensions are plenty

Con:
I found that the Icon does not show in the steam deck's KDE desktop.
And that is the biggest issue I could mention.

Started using this over VScode.

Lapce is a good editor that has future. 
The only thing that annoys me that there are still much differences between Lapce and VIM. For example, while we do :w in VIM to save a file, in Lapce we need to do :save or so and in that "command menu" I was only able to navigate with the arrow keys. That is also not really intended when editing modal.
Also it would be great if we could see the keys we have pressed before an action (for example, the "2" before "j" to see that we move our cursor two times...)
summary: Good, but modal editing could be more vim similar

description: Using Lapce I can do anything I ever did in vscode, but it feels cleaner in it's UI and is much faster. Disabling Inlay hints does seem to be easier. Lapce supports many popular languages similarly to how vscode does it. I highly recommend this, the only downside I find to be is the lack of folding (for now).

It is shocking that, self-proclaimed, PRE-ALPHA software is allowed to even be published on here. Let me be clear potential user, when you click on the menu icon in the top left corner, unless you click on very specific letters on the menu item, it just doesn't even register the menu selection. Setting up Rust just didn't work. Cannot even right click on files area to create a new file. 
Don't get me wrong, these things are expected to be the case for pre-alpha software it's not that Lapce is bad, it just shouldn't be allowed on this store because it isn't ready yet. That wasn't clear when I saw it and thought I'd give it ago. Now I'm put off for life because I've been given a bad impression despite knowing now it is pre-alpha software.
summary: Why is pre-alpha software allowed on here

description: Errors out on startup with no terminal output, so can't even diagnose issue. Flatpak version should be considered borked and clearly isn't release-ready.
I miss some options, but it's obvious since it's in development ;) I have high hopes for it in the future!

It works, it's fast, and I love the minified view! 
Bravo !
